subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Bode Miller was disqualified from a World Cup slalom race by the International Ski Federation for wearing boots that were one-hundredth of an inch too high. Miller finished 29th in the first run of the race, but was disqualified before the second after a random check showed the soles of his boots were a bit high.
